questions.question: DGPS uses a network of___________________ to broadcast the difference between the positions indicated by the GPS satellite system and known fixed positions

explanations.a: Fixed ground-based reference stations: This is the correct answer. DGPS uses a network of fixed ground-based reference stations to broadcast the difference between the positions indicated by the GPS satellite system and known fixed positions.
explanations.b: Fixed satellite station: This is not the correct answer. DGPS uses ground-based reference stations, not satellite stations.
explanations.c: Fixed reference stations: This is not the correct answer. DGPS uses ground-based reference stations, not reference stations that can be fixed or movable.
explanations.d: Fixed area based reference stations: This is not the correct answer. DGPS uses ground-based reference stations that are fixed and located at specific positions.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of DGPS in surveying?

answers.a: To provide accurate and precise positioning data
answers.b: To identify and correct for errors in GPS signals
answers.c: To eliminate the need for ground-based reference stations

explanations.a: DGPS can provide accurate and precise positioning data, but its primary purpose is to correct errors in GPS signals.
explanations.b: The primary purpose of DGPS in surveying is to identify and correct the errors in GPS signals.
explanations.c: DGPS requires ground-based reference stations to broadcast correction information, so it does not eliminate the need for them.
explanations.d: DGPS does not provide real-time weather information.

questions.question: In the RTK method, the base is placed over an unknown point.(say true or false)

explanations.a: The base station in the RTK (Real-Time Kinematic) method is placed over a known point with accurate coordinates. This known point is typically a surveyed point with a known coordinate value.
explanations.b: The base station in RTK (Real-Time Kinematic) method is placed over a known point with accurate coordinates. This known point is typically a surveyed point with a known coordinate value.

questions.question: Which one of the following places do not have a fixed ground-based reference station in India?

explanations.a: Kolkata, Bangalore, and Hyderabad have fixed ground-based reference stations in India for DGPS surveys.
explanations.b: Lucknow does not have fixed ground based reference stations in India for DGPS surveys.
explanations.c: Kolkata, Bangalore, and Hyderabad have fixed ground-based reference stations in India for DGPS surveys.
explanations.d: Kolkata, Bangalore, and Hyderabad have fixed ground-based reference stations in India for DGPS surveys.

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is false in the case of DGPS survey requirements?

answers.a: A clear view of the sky is necessary
answers.b: There is no need to be provided with the known coordinates of a point in an area to start the survey initially
answers.c: Line of sight with the base is necessary

explanations.a: A clear view of the sky is necessary: True, because GPS signals come from satellites in space and require an unobstructed view of the sky.
explanations.b: The rover station can be a mobile system to take to different locations of unknown coordinates: True, because the purpose of the rover is to move around to different locations and collect GPS data.
explanations.c: The base station is not a stationary system: False, because the base station is a stationary system that provides corrections to the GPS signals received by the rover.
explanations.d: Both b and c: False, because option b is true and option c is false.
